1. Gradual Progression: Increase the intensity and duration gradually so you can build up your stamina over time. Do not go all out at once, start with an easy pace and then gradually increase the speed to challenge your body.

2. Interval training: Interval training is a powerful way to improve cardiovascular endurance. It involves alternating periods of high-intensity exercise with periods of rest, repetition of this method will improve your stamina for running on the treadmill.

3. Strength Training: Resistance training routines help to increase power, enhance the muscular endurance that will support you during long treadmill workouts, it would be beneficial to incorporate weight training during your gym sessions.

4. Breathing Technique: Breathing can make or break your endurance during your treadmill workouts, ensure that you keep your breath steady and consistent during your workout.

5. Proper Nutrition: Eating a well-balanced diet with enough protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats to fuel your workouts will help to increase endurance and stamina.

6. Hydration: Drinking enough water before and during a treadmill workout will help maintain hydration to improve endurance and stamina.

7. Rest and Recovery: Giving your body enough time to recover between workouts is essential to building endurance and stamina. Overtraining can lead to fatigue, so rest days are just as important as workout days.
